context_bundle.summary: Efficient task execution via MCP tools. Core pattern: 1. Inventory available MCPs, 2. Match task requirements to tool capabilities, 3. Chain tools for complex operations, 4. Validate results. MCPs extend agent reach beyond conversation into system/network/services.

onboarding.quick_start: Pre-task: List available MCP tools. Match: Map subtasks to specific tools. Execute: Call tools with precise parameters. Chain: Output of tool A feeds tool B. Validate: Check results before proceeding. Fallback: If tool fails, try alternative or escalate. Always prefer tool execution over manual instructions.
common_patterns: Search files (everything) -> Read content (windows-mcp) -> Process -> Write output
Check status first, then proceed with operation
Batch operations: collect inputs, single tool call with array
Error recovery: check status tool, retry with adjusted params
known_errors: Tool timeout - break into smaller operations
Permission denied - check tool capabilities vs request
Tool not found - verify MCP server running, check config
